page.title: 02WESTERHAM C.E.PRIMARY SCHOOL
page.content: Our school is one of the oldest in Kent.The boys went to Hosey Hill where they played in the woods,worked very hard and were extreemly proud of the long history of the school.Mr.Hook,the oldest living old boy told us that during the first world war the army used the woods for grenade practice. Later one boy brought a live grenade he had found into school,which then had to be evacuated! The school had its own song which you can see on other pages. The girls and infants were together at St.Marys and it remained that way until Summer 1983 when the boys and girls were taught together for the first time in 150 years. We hope to be able to have all the school on one site when we move into Churchill Secondary School which is now closed.
